meanings.sent1: The sly fox hoodwinks the rabbit with false promises.
meanings.sent2: She tried to hoodwink her friends into thinking she had already finished her homework.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat hoodwinks the dog by pretending to be invisible.
meanings.sent4: The magician hoodwinks the audience with his incredible disappearing act.
meanings.sent5: The con artist hoodwinks unsuspecting victims out of their money with clever schemes.

meanings.definition: To mislead or deceive by trickery
meanings.sent1: The scammer hoodwinks innocent people into giving away their personal information.
meanings.sent2: He was hoodwinked into buying a fake watch from the street vendor.
meanings.sent3: The clever raccoon hoodwinks the campers by stealing their snacks without them noticing.
meanings.sent4: The illusionist hoodwinks the audience with mind-bending magic tricks.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky spy hoodwinks the enemy agents with his disguise and quick thinking.
